frontmatter.title: Recommended Extensions
frontmatter.description: Quick start guide for getting acclimated with gatsby-theme-carbon

internal.content: --- title: Recommended Extensions description: Quick start guide for getting acclimated with gatsby-theme-carbon --- In addition to Lava for VSCode, the following extensions are useful for Rock RMS developers. Easy LESS filesize GitLens C# XML ## Easy LESS Easily work with LESS files in Visual Studio Code. "Compile-on-save" for LESS stylesheets without using a build task. **Heads Up:** Easy LESS is great, but it can make a serious mess. Make sure to configure a code-workspace for your project! Without configuration, Easy LESS will create a CSS file for _every_ LESS file you save. This is rarely, if ever desired. ## filesize This package is intended for use with the Visual Studio Code editor and it displays the size of the focused file in the status bar of the editor. Bonus: If you click on the status bar component it will display more information about the file! ![filesize](https://cldup.com/_Y52O-UfkK.jpg) ## GitLens GitLens supercharges the Git capabilities built into Visual Studio Code. It helps you to visualize code authorship at a glance via Git blame annotations and code lens, seamlessly navigate and explore Git repositories, gain valuable insights via powerful comparison commands, and so much more. ![GitLens](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eamodio/vscode-gitlens/master/images/docs/gitlens-preview.gif) ## C# C# for Visual Studio Code (powered by OmniSharp) ## XML VS Code doesn’t ship with rich XML tools by default. This extension, built by Red Hat, provides language support for for XML documents such as the -meta.xml or package.xml files in your VS Code project.

Without configuration, Easy LESS will create a CSS file for _every_ LESS file you save. It helps you to visualize code authorship at a glance via Git blame annotations and code lens, seamlessly navigate and explore Git repositories, gain valuable insights via powerful comparison commands, and so much more. ![GitLens](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eamodio/vscode-gitlens/master/images/docs/gitlens-preview.gif) ## C# C# for Visual Studio Code (powered by OmniSharp) ## XML VS Code doesn’t ship with rich XML tools by default.
